intro: Prescottia congesta, commonly known as the clustered Prescottia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value to its habitat. Prescottia congesta is valued for its hardiness and ability to withstand arid conditions, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
